messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:48): Can anyone explain to me why this outputs the empty string to the log in Firefox?  http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/815
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:48): Oh, wait, this one does in WebKit too.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:49): Oh, it has a bug.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:49): I meant this: http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/816
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:50): Hmm, Firefox isn't selecting anything here either . . .
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:51): (visually)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:53): But if I go to the rendered view as a data URL, it does look visually selected, but still the selection stringifies to nothing . . . ?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:53): decides to work on innerText first
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:58): was hoping that would just die
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:00): D'oh, /wc doesn't work on browser windows.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:01): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, WebKit doesn't want it to, so Ian says I should spec it.  It's more useful than textContent, certainly, it's just too bad it's so crazily complicated.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:02): Still, I want it to die
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:08): fixed the error in the post btw
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:08): also pretty great that steve is doing all the additions in the comments
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:09): unless I'd put significantly more time in it it's really quite hard to cover so much
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:09): karlcow: Re: the infrequently.org thing, was that guy asleep when Opera 10 was released?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:10): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: The proposal is gated on people doing version detection properly.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:10): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: It's also gated on the assumption that version detection algorithms never change
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:11): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, innerText and Selection.toString() probably share some underlying algorithm
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, I'd hope so.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:11): If not, maybe we could make it do that.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:11): I wonder how much of copy & paste should be defined in terms of Selection
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:12): I guess that would only cover copying from browsing contexts when there are no plugins involved, but that is still significant
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, could you please serve X-XSS-Protection: 0 from the Live DOM Viewer?  Otherwise it's unusable in recent IE.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:21): (Ref: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2011/01/31/controlling-the-internet-explorer-xss-filter-with-the-x-xss-protection-http-header.aspx)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:22): Oh, wow, Opera's innerText is useless.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:22): So I'm just looking at WebKit and IE, then.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:28): Okay, IE9 works totally differently from IE8 and WebKit . . .
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:32): In IE9, it seems to work mostly like textContent except with different whitespace handling -- in particular, it shows display: none stuff.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:33): IE8 also handles whitespace totally differently from WebKit.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:34): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, do you want me to just make something up or what?  There's almost no common ground here.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:35): WebKit is insane too.  <p> adds two extra newlines, except if the margin is 7px it doesn't but if it's 8px it does, and <div> doesn't add two extra newlines no matter what its margins are . . .
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:36): Although it's a pretty good plaintext approximation to what it looks like.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:37): WebKit seems to use the same algorithm for Selection's stringifier.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:38): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, do you know why this logs nothing?  http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/816
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:38): It makes it hard to test Selection stringification in Firefox.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:38): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: in the absence of interop, yeah, just spec the sanest behaviour
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:41): What I know is that it works if you put w(selection.focusNode) right after selection.collapse(el, 0);
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:42): Okay, well, that works for now, anyway.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:43): Thanks for the tip.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:43): Okay, here's some commonality: selection stringification in Gecko and WebKit seem to at least vaguely resemble each other.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:45): But Firefox appears to ignore most CSS, while most of WebKit's behavior seems determined by CSS.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:45): (for Selection stringification)
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (21:00): hsivonen, there is a single page version of SVG 1.1 2ed: http://dev.w3.org/SVG/profiles/1.1F2/publish/single-page.html
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (21:01): hsivonen, it's linked to just below the list of editors on the front page
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (21:02): hsivonen, also please do read the second edition spec, it's somewhat better than the first...
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:04): One would hope so
